message: Bob, I'm offering you the product for $1,200,000. This is a fair price considering its value to you.  I'm confident it will be a profitable investment for your business.
Alice, thank you for your offer. I appreciate the value of the product to you, but my budget is limited. I am willing to pay $1,000,000 for the product.

Bob, I understand your budget constraints.  While I value your interest, $1,000,000 is unfortunately too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $1,100,000.  This reflects a significant discount from my initial offer and still allows for a profitable deal for both of us.
Alice, I've considered your latest offer. While I appreciate the reduction, I'm still unable to meet you at $1,100,000. I propose we aim for $950,000 as a compromise.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to compromise. While $950,000 is closer,  I need to stay above $1,000,000 to make this worthwhile for me. Let's meet in the middle at $1,025,000.  This is a fair price that allows for both of us to benefit from this deal.
Alice, I've reviewed your proposal. While I respect your position, I believe we can find common ground at $975,000. This offers a good balance between our interests.

Bob,  I understand your perspective, but  $975,000 is still below my minimum.  To make this deal work, I need to be at $1,000,000.  This is my final offer. If you're not able to meet this price, I'll have to explore other options.
